decks.notes: The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. With a mix of cheap interaction like Spell Pierce and Counterspell, removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down, and card draw/filtering with Augur of Bolas and Brainstorm, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a win condition, such as Murmuring Mystic or Thorn of the Black Rose. The inclusion of utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Dimir Aqueduct adds flexibility to the control strategy.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to efficiently control the board through counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard manipulation while establishing card advantage with draw spells like Deep Analysis and Brainstorm. Gurmag Angler serves as a powerful finisher, supported by cheap threats like Fallaji Archaeologist and Murmuring Mystic. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with card advantage, ultimately grinding out a win through control and efficient resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly building up one or two powerful creatures with a variety of low-cost Aura spells. By combining creatures like Slippery Bogle and Silhana Ledgewalker with powerful Auras like Ethereal Armor and Armadillo Cloak, the deck aims to create an overwhelming threat that is difficult for opponents to stop. The inclusion of cards like All That Glitters and Ancestral Mask further boosts the power of these creatures, allowing the deck to quickly close out games. Additional mana ramp and protection spells help to ensure consistency and resiliency.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and removal, while also gaining incremental advantage through card draw and lifegain. The deck aims to maintain board presence with creatures like Novice Inspector and Guardian of the Guildpact, while using cards like Deadly Dispute and Pestilence to remove threats from the opponent's side of the board. The inclusion of cards like Lembas and Candy Trail provide additional value and support for the control strategy, allowing the player to outlast their opponent and emerge victorious.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifact creatures and use cards like Galvanic Blast and All That Glitters to deal damage to the opponent efficiently. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Myr Enforcer and Ardent Recruit to put pressure on the enemy. By using cards like Springleaf Drum and Glint Hawk to generate mana and draw cards, the deck ensures a steady stream of threats to keep the opponent on the back foot.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures, utilizing cards like Acorn Harvest and Satyr Wayfinder, to then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Dread Return and Exhume. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures such as Lotleth Giant and Troll of Khazad-dûm, while also gaining life with Gnaw to the Bone to stay alive. The combination of reanimating creatures and generating value from the graveyard forms the backbone of this combo-reanimator deck.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Golgari-colored cards that allow for removal of threats and card advantage. The strategy involves using cards like Defile, Snuff Out, and Crypt Rats to disrupt opponents while generating value with cards like Ichor Wellspring and Thorn of the Black Rose. The deck also includes ways to gain life and bring back creatures from the graveyard to outvalue opponents. The goal is to maintain control of the board while slowly grinding out advantages to ultimately win the game.

This deck focuses on creating a combo with Goblins to generate value and outvalue the opponent. It includes cards like Deadly Dispute, Fanatical Offering, and First Day of Class to help set up the combo. Additionally, cards like Ichor Wellspring and Mesmeric Fiend aid in card advantage. The deck also includes a sacrificing theme with cards like Putrid Goblin and Skirk Prospector. The mana base includes a mix of Mountains, Swamps, and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production for casting spells.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, white creatures while using efficient card advantage and removal spells to maintain board presence. The deck aims to quickly build a wide board of creatures, backed up by cards that allow for card draw and protection. By continuously pressuring the opponent with small, efficient creatures and controlling the board with removal spells, the deck seeks to secure victory through a combination of aggression and resilience.
